headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; Arrival of Colonel Kane--Governor Cumming's Dispatches. Intended Resignation of Minister Reed Success of the Colorado Expedition--The Overland California Mall. FROM WASHINGTON.

docs.abstract: A Peace Commission to be sent to Paraguay
docs.lead_paragraph: The State Department has received dispatches from Minister REED, announcing his intended resignation and return from China. A report has been received by the War Department from Lieutenant l??ves, setting forth the entire success of his exploration so far as he has gone. The navigation of the Colorado is entirely safe for large steamers. The health of his men is good.

headline.main: Quarantine Affairs. The steamer Black Warrior, Capt. SMITH, arrived from Havana on Saturday evening with about 150 passengers.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Black Warrior, Capt. SMITH, arrived from Havana on Saturday evening with about 150 pasSENGERS. At 7 o'clock last evening she was still detained at quarantine on account of sickness on board. Coming from a port where yellow fever prevails to a considerable extent, she would naturally be detained a reasonable time that she might be inspected, fumigated and cleansed;

headline.main: Santa Anna's Manifesto to the Mexicans. In March Gen. SANTA ANNA departed from his charming retreat at Tusbaco, in New-Granada.

docs.lead_paragraph: In March Gen. SANTA ANNA departed from his charming retreat at Tubbaco, in New-Granada,where of for two or three years past he has been enjoying the felicities of repose and cock-fighting, and took up his line of March for Mexico. He was encouraged by the disturbed condition of that Republic to believe that he might once more put himself at the head of affairs.

docs.snippet: DELUGE OF THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI.--Another disastrous crevasse occurred at the Yazoo Pass, in the State of Mississippi, on Thursday night, which, it is said, will submerge the entire valley of the Yazoo River.
docs.lead_paragraph: DELUGE OF THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI.--Another disastrous crevasse occurred at the Yazoo Pass, in the State of Mississippi, on Thursday night, which, it is said, will submerge the entire valley of the Yazoo River.

docs.snippet: The Rev. Mr. WEBB, of Augusta, Me., has been called, by a unanimous vote, to the pastoral care of the Bowdoin-street Church, in Boston. This is one of the most liberal churches in Boston. At the close of the labors of the Rev. J. B. WATERBURY, about...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Rev. Mr. WEBB, of Augusta, Me., has been called, by a unanimous vote, to the pastoral care of the Bowdoin-street Church, in Boston. This is one of the most liberal churches in Boston. At the close of the labors of the Rev. J. B. WATERBURY, about one year since, the Church gave him, as a present, $5,000. The salary to Mr. WEBB is $3,000; $1,000 more than was paid to Dr. WATERBURY

docs.abstract: Detailed account of the reception of Gov Cummings
docs.lead_paragraph: Arrival of seventy Mormon Families at Camp Scott. ST. LOUIS, Friday, June 19. Additional details by the Salt Lake mail say tha seventy Mormon families had arrived at Camp Scott Asking protection, which was given. Capt. HARRIS, with 250 head of beef cattle, was met at Harris' Fork, 15 miles this side of Camp Scott.

headline.main: Fuss over Small Matters-Neglect of Large Ones.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: Your correspondent," N. R.," a day or two since, says: " Our most essential City regulations are constantly disregarded; our streets are left in poisonous filth; bales and boxes are permitted to encounter the pavement, and to encroach on the lights of the passengers; indecent interments, dangerous to health.
